column5: You didn't offend me..LOL I was just answering your question.
i hear we can now bring up to 10 pounds of potatos into ontario - can anyone confirm?? thanks, phish
Yes its OK, no limits that I know of. I take 10 #s
Can someone confrim whether you can bring in other fresh produce such as onions and peppers? if not does anyone have a link of where to look it up? thanks
we have never had a problem with other fresh produce
Scroll down and read under "fruits and vegetables: fresh"http://www.beaware.gc.ca/english/brirape.shtml20 kilograms is roughly 44 pounds per person
sorry to offend Camp Chef. I knew we always stopped for potatoes and got other fresh stuff up there but didn't really know why. good to know.
I'm happy to see the Canadian Government spelled potatoes correctly
well, it's about time - it was always a hastle to make a specific stop for a few potatos. thanks for the responses. phish

I buy cans of potatoes. there are whole and sliced. They cook faster than raw potatoes and tast erally good with onions/cheese. If you use them for baked potatoes, then, you will need raw whole potatoes.
An end to the great Canadian potato ban! Perhaps we can bring more beer as well, just to celebrate????
